title: Q22 - Organization of Ideas
prompt:
(22) The writer wants to add the following sentence to the third paragraph.

He comes through the door and plops down at the table with me, as if he’s in a hurry.

Where is the best place in paragraph three to add this sentence?
description: This question refers to the paragraph as a whole.
feedback: The best place to add this sentence is after the second sentence of the third paragraph. The paragraph should read: “Finally, I hear his step on the stairs. I sit up straight in my chair in anticipation. He comes through the door and plops down at the table with me, as if he’s in a hurry. He doesn’t seem to even realize that it’s April Fool’s Day. He glances at me and asks, ‘Sleep well?’ as he sprinkles ‘sugar’ on his cereal and douses it with milk.” This story is told in chronological order, from beginning to end. At the beginning of the paragraph, the narrator hears his father on the stairs. In the third sentence of the original paragraph, the narrator talks about his father’s attitude. He never mentions the father entering the room. The new sentence should go before the third sentence, since it describes his father entering the room.
